intro: Macrolobium ivorense, commonly known as the Ivory Coast macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
